means: 愤怒地，愤慨地，愤愤不平地

sentence.Network_en: "Well!", said the innkeeper, drawing herself up indignantly.
sentence.Network_cn: “行！”客栈老板娘挺直身子愤然说道。

sentence.Network_en: "That is not true," Erica said indignantly.
sentence.Network_cn: “那不是真的，”埃丽卡愤怒地说。

sentence.Network_en: " I don't agree at all,'she answered indignantly.
sentence.Network_cn: “ 我压根儿不同意, ” 她气愤地答道.

Edward snorted indignantly ., 爱德华鼻子里气愤地哼了一声.

list.abs: The indignantly struggling sun seems to be saying ., 愤怒地挣扎的夕阳似乎在说;
they indignantly protested when they were told that they had to leave the city当他们被告知离开此城时，他们愤怒地表示抗议
... 愤愤不平[ be indignant;feel aggrieved;with bitter complaint] 愤恨[ indignantly resent;enmity] 愤慨[ indignation].
" You foul-mouthed sex-obsessed swine , " retorted the lady indignantly . " In this country , we don't' aloud in public places about our sex lives !“你们这两个口无遮拦的家伙！”女士生气说道，“在这个国家，我们可不在公共场所大声讨论自己的性生活。”

entry.def: If you are indignant, you are shocked and angry, because you think that something is unjust or unfair.

example.ex: He is indignant at suggestions that they were secret agents...
example.tran: 有人暗示他们可能是特务,这让他非常气愤。

example.ex: MPs were indignant that the government had not consulted them...
example.tran: 政府没有事先征求他们的意见,下院议员们感到很愤怒。

sentences.sentence: "Miss Burney protested indignantly, her long thin nose turning pink with mortification at this irreverent piece of mimicry"

auth_sentence.content: They have called me treacherous, he said indignantly.
auth_sentence.res_content: They have called me treacherous, he said indignantly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They have called me treacherous, he said indignantly.

auth_sentence.content: "It barely passed it," Ren said indignantly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "It barely passed it," Ren said indignantly.

auth_sentence.content: A weird creature..., a pear-shaped body, long antennae that twitched indignantly.
auth_sentence.res_content: A weird creature..., a pear-shaped body, long antennae that twitched indignantly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A weird creature..., a pear-shaped body, long antennae that twitched indignantly.

means.word_mean: 愤怒地;愤慨地,愤愤不平地

sentences.en: He snorted indignantly and walked away.
sentences.cn: 他气愤地哼了一声，走开了。

sentences.en: The paper indignantly rejected charges that it had invented the story to boost sales.
sentences.cn: 该报愤然否认了曾为增加销售量而编造故事的指控。

sentences.en: “I don’t agree at all,” she answered indignantly.
sentences.cn: “我压根儿不同意,”她气愤地答道。
